dashboard.site.status.activateHelp: Activating enables crawls and serving for configured languages. Domains still need verification to go live.
dashboard.site.status.deactivateConfirm: Pause localization? This won't delete your translations, but it will stop serving localized pages. Visitors will be redirected to the original site.
dashboard.site.settings.crawlCapture.des: Choose how we capture HTML for segmentation and runtime dictionary coverage.
dashboard.site.settings.crawlCapture.hel: Template+hydrated is best for most sites. Use hydrated-only if JS is required to render meaningful content.
dashboard.site.settings.clientRuntime.de: Inject a runtime dictionary so client-side renders stay translated.
dashboard.site.settings.clientRuntime.he: Recommended for SPA/hydrated sites to prevent source-language re-renders.
dashboard.site.settings.spaRefresh.title: Client-side navigation support
dashboard.site.settings.spaRefresh.descr: Enable this if your site changes pages without a full reload. Weblingo will fetch route-scoped dictionaries on navigation for better coverage.
dashboard.site.settings.spaRefresh.label: Enable client-side navigation support
dashboard.site.settings.spaRefresh.help: Turn this on for in-page route changes (URL changes but the document does not reload).
dashboard.site.settings.spaRefresh.note: Uses /.well-known/weblingo/dict/... on navigation. If CSP blocks connect-src, refresh will not run.
dashboard.site.settings.spaRefresh.missi: When a route dictionary is missing, choose Global-only (safer) or Baseline (more coverage with higher collision risk).
dashboard.site.settings.spaRefresh.error: When the dictionary fetch fails (network/CSP), choose Global-only (safer) or Baseline (more coverage).
dashboard.site.settings.spaRefresh.secti: Uses section dictionaries when route dicts are missing. Increases the candidate pool; enable only when needed.
dashboard.site.settings.translatableAttr: Translate select HTML attributes (tooltips, labels) without editing the source site.
Comma-separated attribute names. Only data-* and aria-* attributes are allowed.
dashboard.site.settings.lockedHelp: This setting is locked for your account. Contact support to enable editing.

home.problem.description: Most automated translation tools sound robotic or misrepresent your brand. Manual translation is slow, expensive, and needs to be redone every time your site changes.

home.faq.q1.question: Do I need to update my website code?
home.faq.q1.answer: No. You don’t need to change your website, but you can optionally add a link to your translated pages. Contact us if you need help adding it.
home.faq.q2.question: Can my e-commerce website or user dashboard be translated?
home.faq.q2.answer: Currently, WebLingo handles static pages (showcase, corporate, documentation, etc.). Support for dynamic websites is on our roadmap and will be available for Pro customers.
home.faq.q3.question: Are there usage limits?
home.faq.q3.answer: No traffic quotas, no word limit, no page limit — fair-use applies. You pay per website and optional extra languages.
home.faq.q4.question: Is hosting included?
home.faq.q4.answer: Yes — every translated page is hosted for free across 330+ Cloudflare CDN locations.
home.faq.q5.question: Can I cancel anytime?
home.faq.q5.answer: Yes. Subscriptions can be monthly or annual — just cancel before your next invoice.
